DataElement.preferredName: Study Patient Reported Outcome Measure Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The words by which survey measures that are completed by the patient which help assess patient status with regards to pain, mobility, quality of life, ability to perform daily tasks or notable events in a clinical study is known.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:Survey measures that are completed by the patient which help assess patient status with regards to pain, mobility, quality of life, ability to perform daily tasks or notable events in a clinical study.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A detailed critical inspection; a research project.

Concepts.definition: A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.

Property.preferredDefinition: Survey measures that are completed by the patient which help assess patient status with regards to pain, mobility, quality of life, ability to perform daily tasks or notable events in a clinical study.

Concepts.definition: Survey measures that are completed by the patient which help assess patient status with regards to pain, mobility, quality of life, ability to perform daily tasks or notable events in a clinical study.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 5/18/23 Related CDE retired/superceded by CDE 12960571 for PCDC Study ID. jk;  4/16/23 Created for the PCDC-C3DC Aggregated Dictionary data elements. jk

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Survey measures that are completed by the patient which help assess patient status with regards to pain, mobility, quality of life, ability to perform daily tasks or notable events in a clinical study._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire designed to measure hearing loss or problems experienced by patients who have received treatment for cancer.

Concepts.definition: A questionnaire designed to measure hearing loss or problems experienced by patients who have received treatment for cancer.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: EORTC QLQ-C30 Health and Quality of Life Rating Scale
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A scale used both for the subjective scoring of a person's overall health, and for their quality of life, that ranges from 1: Very Poor to 7: Excellent.

Concepts.longName: EORTC QLQ-C30 Health and Quality of Life Rating Scale
Concepts.definition: A scale used both for the subjective scoring of a person's overall health, and for their quality of life, that ranges from 1: Very Poor to 7: Excellent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire tool to assess the neurotoxic effects of cancer therapy.

Concepts.definition: A questionnaire tool to assess the neurotoxic effects of cancer therapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A scale designed to quantify a patient's improvement or deterioration over time during the clinical course of a condition.

Concepts.definition: A scale designed to quantify a patient's improvement or deterioration over time during the clinical course of a condition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A measurement system that characterized the frequency, severity, interference, and presence/absence of symptomatic toxicities that include pain, fatigue, nausea, and cutaneous side effects such as rash and hand-foot syndrome, all toxicities that can be meaningfully reported from the patient perspective. The pediatric module permits self-reporting by children and adolescents ages 7-17 years.

Concepts.definition: A measurement system that characterized the frequency, severity, interference, and presence/absence of symptomatic toxicities that include pain, fatigue, nausea, and cutaneous side effects such as rash and hand-foot syndrome, all toxicities that can be meaningfully reported from the patient perspective. The pediatric module permits self-reporting by children and adolescents ages 7-17 years.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory-Multidimensional Fatigue Scale
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An 18 item component of the Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory is a generic symptom-specific instrument to measure fatigue in pediatric patients ages 2-18 comprised of General Fatigue, Sleep/Rest Fatigue, and Cognitive Fatigue domains.

Concepts.longName: Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory-Multidimensional Fatigue Scale
Concepts.definition: An 18 item component of the Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory is a generic symptom-specific instrument to measure fatigue in pediatric patients ages 2-18 comprised of General Fatigue, Sleep/Rest Fatigue, and Cognitive Fatigue domains.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Patient Reported Outcomes Version of CTCAE
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A library of items for patient self-reporting of symptoms and side effects associated with cancer treatment trials.

Concepts.longName: Patient Reported Outcomes Version of CTCAE
Concepts.definition: A library of items for patient self-reporting of symptoms and side effects associated with cancer treatment trials.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Child self-report and parent proxy report scales developed to measure health-related quality of life issues in children and adolescents aged 2-18.

Concepts.definition: Child self-report and parent proxy report scales developed to measure health-related quality of life issues in children and adolescents aged 2-18.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A 10 question instrument designed to provide an efficient way of gathering general perceptions of health.

Concepts.definition: A 10 question instrument designed to provide an efficient way of gathering general perceptions of health.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A patient reported outcome measure that refelects the physical, emotional, social, financial well being and sexuality of individuals with sarcoma.

Concepts.definition: A patient reported outcome measure that refelects the physical, emotional, social, financial well being and sexuality of individuals with sarcoma.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Toronto Extremity Salvage Score, Upper Extremity
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A self-administered questionnaire designed to assess physical disability for patients undergoing upper limb salvage surgery for musculoskeletal tumors.

Concepts.longName: Toronto Extremity Salvage Score, Upper Extremity
Concepts.definition: A self-administered questionnaire designed to assess physical disability for patients undergoing upper limb salvage surgery for musculoskeletal tumors.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.2.1 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001995. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.
Not provided or available.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 10/10/23 changed Long Name from "Not Stated" to match NCIt Preferred name and current caDSR concept Long Name of "Not Reported" per Brenda.Janice . LS

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A self-report tool that evaluates fatigue over a range of symptoms, from mild subjective feelings of tiredness to an overwhelming, debilitating, and sustained sense of exhaustion that likely decreases one's ability to execute daily activities and function normally in family or social roles. The fatigue short form is generic rather than disease specific and assesses fatigue over the past seven days.

Concepts.definition: A self-report tool that evaluates fatigue over a range of symptoms, from mild subjective feelings of tiredness to an overwhelming, debilitating, and sustained sense of exhaustion that likely decreases one's ability to execute daily activities and function normally in family or social roles. The fatigue short form is generic rather than disease specific and assesses fatigue over the past seven days.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Toronto Extremity Salvage Score, Lower Extremity
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A self-administered questionnaire designed to assess physical disability for patients undergoing lower limb salvage sugery for musculoskeletal tumors.

Concepts.longName: Toronto Extremity Salvage Score, Lower Extremity
Concepts.definition: A self-administered questionnaire designed to assess physical disability for patients undergoing lower limb salvage sugery for musculoskeletal tumors.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.
